title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 230.1 - Use of the auditorium in the State Education Building
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 230.1 - Use of the auditorium in the State Education Building

State Regulations
(a) When not required to serve the program
needs of the Education Department, the auditorium in the State Education

Building (Chancellors Hall) may be made available for general public and
private use in accordance with the limitations and requirements of this
section. (b) The auditorium in the

State Education Building (Chancellors Hall) may not be used for the
presentation of any programs that are religious, political or commercial, or at
which attendance is exclusive, except that attendance at meetings under the
control of institutions in the University of the State of New York may be
exclusive. (c) Fees charged each
person, association, organization or corporation permitted the use of the
auditorium will be in accordance with the following fee schedule: Regular Department

Workday

Morning

Afternoon

Morning

Afternoon

Evening

Maintenance and custodial charges
$100
$100
$150
$150
$150

Each guard (when required)
$40
$60
$ 60
$ 60
$ 60
(d) The Education Department reserves the
right to require the use of up to four building guards for any event if it is
deemed by the department that their services are required to provide adequate
audience safety. (e) No fee will be
charged to any State agency granted the use of the hall. Notes

230.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
